maml:description.maml:para: This Creates an Instance of the Logger Class to enable simple loggging for scripts and modules.

maml:Description.maml:para: This is the name of the log used within the log file and in the default file path.
This is the file path used to overide the default file path.
This is the name of the log used within the log file and in the default file path.
This is the file path used to overide the default file path.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet returns a Logger object.
This object contains the following parameters and Methods Parameters `$FilePath`
This Parameter contains the filepath that the Logger Will write to. It is a string object.
This Parameter contains the name of thew logger class used when writing to the log. It is a string object. Methods ` Log(<string>)`
This method logs the string to the Output window and to the command line.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Logger = New-Logger -Name 'DeploymentLog' PS C:\> $Logger.Log("Create a New Log Entry")

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will create a new instance of the logger class at the default location with the Name of 'DeploymentLog'.
The default location for a log file is `C:\PSLogging` and the file name follows this format `Log.$LogName.dd.MM.yyyy.log1`.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $LogPath = 'D:\Logs\Deployment.' + $(get-date -Format "yyyy.MM.dd").ToString() + '.log' PS C:\> $Logger = New-Logger -Name 'DeploymentLog' -FilePath $LogPath PS C:\> $Logger.Log('Deployment Script Started')

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will create a new instance of the logger class uaing the specifed path with the name of 'DeploymentLog'
